image.altText: Two women smile as they sign documents in front of a crowd.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government is set to make a historic apology to Aboriginal Victorians today, in one of the first public acts to follow the signing of the state's treaty agreement.

title.children: Victorian government to make historic apology to Aboriginal Victorians

image.altText: A police car and police tape on a busy street.

props.synopsis: Police charge an 18-year-old man with offences including intentionally causing injury and affray, following the incident that claimed the life of a 40-year-old in Ascot Vale on Sunday afternoon.

title.children: Teenager allegedly involved in fatal Melbourne stabbing faces court

image.altText: A toy car on fire

props.synopsis: Fire services are urging people to buy lithium-ion battery products from reputable suppliers ahead of Christmas after yet another house fire was suspected to have been caused by a lithium battery on the weekend.

title.children: Another house fire likely sparked by lithium battery as firies reissue safety warnings

image.altText: Nikkita Azzopardi, pictured smiling at a party.

props.synopsis: The family of a Melbourne woman who was brutally killed by her partner say they're distraught after the man was found not guilty due to mental impairment.

title.children: Man found not guilty of Melbourne woman's murder due to mental impairment

image.altText: An aerial shot of the scene of a collision between a vehicle and a building in Melbourne's north-west.

props.synopsis: A male pedestrian has been killed and a woman seriously injured after a car crashed into a medical centre in Melbourne's north-west, travelling for 30 metres before it came to a halt.

title.children: Pedestrian killed as car crashes into Melbourne medical centre

image.altText: A woman at a computer with a transgender flag in the background.

props.synopsis: Victoria Police fought a legal battle with a transgender woman for more than two years before admitting it incorrectly referred her to men's support services.

title.children: Trans woman took on police and won after being referred to men's help service

image.altText: A carer pushes Connie. Both are smiling.

props.synopsis: Parents of some of Victoria's most vulnerable people fear what will happen to their loved ones if hundreds of group homes are forced to close.

title.children: Families 'devastated' amid fears of Victorian group home closures

image.altText: A view across a wide street of an attractive, two storey goldrush-era corner building with lattice ironwork.

props.synopsis: For its passionate members, saving a historic goldrush-era pub to protect their cooperative was about "economic democracy" and keeping the property out of developers' hands.

title.children: A 'broken' property market spurred hundreds of locals to buy a building

image.altText: Victorian police officer from behind

props.synopsis: A legal challenge is launched against a "designated area" declaration for Melbourne's CBD that gives police greater powers to search people without a warrant.

title.children: Legal challenge to search powers as police target Melbourne shopping centres

image.altText: Woman sitting in a tractor.

props.synopsis: Mixed farming, which involves growing crops and rearing livestock, used to be standard practice in Australia, but there are almost 100 million fewer sheep in Australia than there were 35 years ago.

title.children: Move aside sheep, crops are taking over in mixed-farming regions

image.altText: Ribbons tied to fence.

props.synopsis: Newcastle and Ballarat are 1,100 kilometres apart but share a dark bond — scores of suicide deaths linked to historical Catholic clergy abuse.

title.children: Cities 1,100 kilometres apart share dark bond linked to abuse

image.altText: A small train carries passengers with a station behind it.

props.synopsis: A group of dedicated volunteers say they have built "Australia's biggest" miniature railway in regional Victoria and after a decade of hard work it's finally open to the public.

title.children: Victorian hobby club opens 'Australia's biggest' miniature railway

image.altText: A Latina woman with long brown hair and a guide dog walking across a crowded crossing

props.synopsis: Living with vision impairment throws up many challenges. Being Deaf on top of that requires you to go to even greater lengths just to fit in with the modern world. This is how one Deafblind woman does it.

title.children: Jael is Deaf and blind. Here's how she goes about her day

image.altText: A badly smashed black sedan car in a paddock.

props.synopsis: A 16-year-old boy is alleged to have been the driver of a car which crashed into a pole early Sunday, killing a 17-year-old passenger.

title.children: Charges laid against teen after fatal crash near Geelong

image.altText: A white seagull with orange beak and legs, grey wings and black tail stands on bitumen.

props.synopsis: Pesky seagulls snatching food from unsuspecting members of the public has spurred a Melbourne council to start canine patrols of Federation Square.

title.children: Dog patrols at Federation Square to curb 'terrifying' seagull swooping

image.altText: A close up of a turtle, with a a view under the shell

props.synopsis: Researchers in Victoria are using taste aversion conditioning to stop foxes eating native turtle eggs.

title.children: Making foxes feel sick might be the key to saving native turtles

image.altText: William Swale at court

props.synopsis: A diabetic man previously charged over a crash that killed five wants to object to giving evidence, on the grounds it may be self-incriminating.

title.children: Diabetic driver hopes to avoid witness box in Daylesford crash inquest

image.altText: mine operations and lots of equipment

props.synopsis: An investigation is underway following the death of a 53-year-old man who was trapped under machinery at a gold mine in Central Victoria on Friday.

title.children: Man dies after being trapped under machinery at Victorian gold mine

image.altText: A house burnt with chimeys remaining and bushland in the background

props.synopsis: North-east Victorian residents are still unable to return home as firefighters assess bushfire damage.

title.children: Residents still unable to return home as extent of bushfire damage uncertain

image.altText: A sign hanging on a fence, blocking a path.

props.synopsis: Asbestos has been discovered scattered throughout parts of a coastal town near the Great Ocean Road, prompting land managers to close a section to the public.

title.children: Asbestos found along walking track near Great Ocean Road

image.altText: a historic aerial photo of three north melbourne public housing towers in black and white

props.synopsis: A 1960s North Melbourne public housing tower slated for imminent demolition has been nominated for protection under state heritage laws, following a successful appeal by a tenants group.

title.children: Heritage bid to save public housing tower slated for demolition

image.altText: Melbourne State Theatre

props.synopsis: No sensible organisation can now afford to turn down money or its requirements. So, cash-strapped institutions find themselves between a rock and a hard place with a big name painted on it.

title.children: Why all of Melbourne's major arts institutions have the same name

image.altText: bushfire

props.synopsis: Some parts of the state hit 38 degrees Celsius as emergency services manage the risk of bushfire in regional Victoria.

title.children: Bushfires flare, air tanker crashes as temperatures soar in Victoria

image.altText: Rory McIlroy looks on at the Australian Open.

props.synopsis: Rory McIlroy's appearance at the Australian Open in Melbourne has gone a long way to restoring the prestige of the tournament.

title.children: McIlroy completes Australian Open mission even if he did not lift trophy

image.altText: An emergency services tent is set up on a road with police standing nearby.

props.synopsis: A man has handed himself into police after a 28-year-old Lilydale man died following an alleged fatal hit and run in Mooroolbark on Friday morning

title.children: Man arrested after alleged hit and run in Melbourne's east

image.altText: The outside of the County Court of Victoria building.

props.synopsis: A County Court jury finds a man guilty of two charges of raping a woman in his home after a night of drinking with friends.

title.children: Man from high-profile Victorian family found guilty of rape

image.altText: An artist's impression of wind turbines sitting offshore.

props.synopsis: Energy giant AGL has become the third company this year to abandon plans to develop an offshore wind farm in Victoria's east.

title.children: AGL latest company to abandon Victorian offshore wind project

image.altText: An old woman and man, both wearing glasses, sit on chairs around a round wooden table

props.synopsis: The family of the late first wife of High Country killer Greg Lynn says a fresh investigation into her death has stalled because police won't pay for an expert report.

title.children: Fresh probe into Lisa Lynn's death stalls over $9,000 bill, family says

image.altText: Woman with brown hair wearing glasses with black background.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government has backed down on key parts of an unpopular tax used to fund the state's emergency services as part of its budget update.

title.children: Government freezes controversial levy for farmers in budget update

image.altText: Dezi Freeman pictured outside a court in Wangaratta.

props.synopsis: Victoria Police says a targeted search has focused on locating evidence or the body of fugitive Dezi Freeman, four months after he allegedly fatally shot two police officers in Porepunkah, in north-east Victoria.

title.children: Latest Dezi Freeman search focused on finding 'body'

image.altText: A building with a maroon sign that says "Keysborough College" and purple and white vertical signs, one saying "respect".

props.synopsis: A 37-year-old teacher accused of stabbing a principal at a school in Melbourne's south-east on Tuesday "snapped" after learning his contract would not be renewed, a court has heard.

title.children: Teacher 'snapped' over contract before stabbing principal, court hears

image.altText: Rory McIlroy looks to the sky during his second round of the Australian Open.

props.synopsis: Much to the relief of tournament organisers and his legion of fans, Rory McIlroy survives to fight another day at the Australian Open.

title.children: McIlroy nervously avoids Australian Open cut as Lee lights up

image.altText: A man wearing a black leather jacket and black head covering stands in front of a stone wall with a motorcycle attached to it.

props.synopsis: Motorcyclists in regional SA and south-west Victoria say pothole-riddled regional roads are taking a physical, mental and financial toll on riders.

title.children: Fed up motorcyclists call for dangerous potholes littering highways to be fixed

image.altText: David sits on a chair and looks at the camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Elderly residents in Melbourne's south-east say they are in financial distress after two rent increases, which a community housing organisation says are a necessary move to a standard rent-setting model.

title.children: Pensioners handed consecutive rent rises after new provider takes over

image.altText: Brodie wearing a netball shirt and holding a netball

props.synopsis: Brodie Taylor has changed the game of netball by overturning disability preconceptions to become the first person in a wheelchair to attain national netball umpiring accreditation.

title.children: This 18-year-old is the first badged netball umpire in a wheelchair
